Test Scenario: New user can register with valid credentials
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Enter valid email address
3. Enter password (min 8 characters)
4. Enter first name and last name
5. Click Register button
Expected Result:
User account is created successfully
User is redirected to login page
Success message is displayed

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Enter invalid email (e.g., 'notanemail')
3. Enter valid password
4. Enter name fields
5. Click Register button
Expected Result:
Error message displayed: 'Invalid email format'
User remains on registration page
Account is not created

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Enter valid email
3. Enter password less than 8 characters
4. Enter name fields
5. Click Register button
Expected Result:
Error message displayed: 'Password must be at least 8 characters'
Account is not created

Test Scenario: User can login with valid credentials
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter registered email
3. Enter correct password
4. Click Login button
Expected Result:
User is authenticated successfully
Redirected to appropriate dashboard based on role
Session is created

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter registered email
3. Enter incorrect password
4. Click Login button
Expected Result:
Error message: 'Invalid credentials'
User remains on login page
No session created

Test Scenario: User can login with Google account
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Click 'Sign in with Google' button
3. Select Google account
4. Authorize application
Expected Result:
User is authenticated via Google OAuth
Redirected to dashboard
Session is created
Google calendar sync is available

Test Steps:
1. Login to application
2. Wait for 60 minutes without activity
3. Try to perform any action
Expected Result:
Session expires
User is redirected to login page
Message: 'Session expired, please login again'

Test Steps:
1. Click on user profile menu
2. Click Logout button
Expected Result:
User is logged out
Session is destroyed
Redirected to login page

Test Scenario: Admin can view all users in system
Test Steps:
1. Login as Admin
2. Navigate to Admin Portal
3. Click on Users section
Expected Result:
List of all users displayed
Shows: name, email, role, status
Pagination works correctly

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Users section
2. Click 'Add User' button
3. Fill in user details (email, name, role)
4. Click Save
Expected Result:
New user is created
User appears in users list
User receives invitation email (if configured)

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with existing user
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Users section
2. Click Edit on specific user
3. Modify user details (name, role, etc.)
4. Click Save
Expected Result:
User details are updated
Changes reflected in user list
Activity log shows the update

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with active user
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Users section
2. Select user to deactivate
3. Click Deactivate button
4. Confirm action
Expected Result:
User account is deactivated
User cannot login
User removed from team assignments

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with existing user
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Users section
2. Click on user to edit
3. Change role (ADMIN, LEADER, MEMBER)
4. Save changes
Expected Result:
User role is updated
User permissions reflect new role
User can access appropriate portal sections

Test Steps:
1. Login as any user
2. Click on profile icon/menu
3. Select 'My Profile'
Expected Result:
User profile page displayed
Shows: name, email, role, teams
Profile picture (if available)

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to profile page
2. Click Edit Profile
3. Update name, profile picture, bio
4. Save changes
Expected Result:
Profile updated successfully
Changes reflected across application
Success message displayed

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Teams section
2. Click 'Create Team' button
3. Enter team name and description
4. Click Save
Expected Result:
New team is created
Team appears in teams list
Activity log records team creation

Prerequisites: Admin or Leader logged in with existing team
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Teams section
2. Select team to edit
3. Update team name or description
4. Save changes
Expected Result:
Team details are updated
Changes visible to all team members
Activity log shows update

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with existing team
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Teams section
2. Select team to delete
3. Click Delete button
4. Confirm deletion
Expected Result:
Team is deleted
Team members are unassigned
Tasks associated with team are archived/deleted
Activity log records deletion

Test Scenario: Leader can add members to team
Prerequisites: Leader logged in with team access
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to team details page
2. Click 'Add Member' button
3. Search and select users
4. Assign roles within team
5. Save
Expected Result:
Users added to team
Members can see team in their dashboard
Activity log shows member addition

Test Scenario: Leader can remove members from team
Prerequisites: Leader logged in with team having members
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to team members section
2. Select member to remove
3. Click Remove button
4. Confirm action
Expected Result:
Member removed from team
Member loses access to team tasks
Activity log records removal

Test Scenario: Member can view own team details
Prerequisites: Member logged in and assigned to team
Test Steps:
1. Login as team member
2. Navigate to Teams section
3. Click on assigned team
Expected Result:
Team details displayed
Shows team name, description, members
Shows assigned tasks

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with existing team
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to team details
2. Select member to make leader
3. Assign LEADER role
4. Save changes
Expected Result:
User role updated to LEADER
User gains leader permissions for team
Can manage team tasks and members

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Tasks section
2. Click 'Create Task' button
3. Enter task details (title, description, due date)
4. Assign to team/user
5. Set priority and status
6. Click Save
Expected Result:
New task is created
Task appears in tasks list
Assigned users receive notification
Activity log records creation

Prerequisites: User logged in with existing task
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to task details
2. Click Edit button
3. Modify task details
4. Save changes
Expected Result:
Task is updated
Changes reflected immediately
Activity log shows modification
Assigned users notified of changes

Prerequisites: Admin or task creator logged in
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to task details
2. Click Delete button
3. Confirm deletion
Expected Result:
Task is deleted
Removed from all views
Activity log records deletion
Comments archived

Test Scenario: User can assign task to team members
Test Steps:
1. Open task details
2. Click Assign button
3. Select team members
4. Save assignment
Expected Result:
Task assigned to selected members
Members see task in their dashboard
Notification sent to assignees

Prerequisites: Member logged in with assigned task
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to assigned task
2. Change status (TODO, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED)
3. Save changes
Expected Result:
Task status updated
Status change visible to team
Activity log records status change
Team leader notified

Prerequisites: User logged in with task access
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Tasks section
2. Click on specific task
Expected Result:
Task details page displayed
Shows: title, description, assignees, status, priority, due date
Shows comments and activity history

Test Scenario: User can filter tasks by various criteria
Prerequisites: User logged in with multiple tasks
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Tasks section
2. Apply filters (status, priority, assignee, due date)
3. View filtered results
Expected Result:
Tasks filtered correctly
Only matching tasks displayed
Filter options are clear and functional
Can clear filters to reset

Prerequisites: User logged in with multiple tasks
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Tasks section
2. Click on column headers to sort
3. Try different sort orders (date, priority, status)
Expected Result:
Tasks sorted correctly
Sort direction indicated (ascending/descending)
Sort persists during session

Test Steps:
1. Open task details
2. Change priority (HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW)
3. Save changes
Expected Result:
Priority updated successfully
Visual indicator shows priority level
High priority tasks highlighted

Prerequisites: User logged in with tasks past due date
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Tasks section
2. View tasks with past due dates
Expected Result:
Overdue tasks clearly marked
Red/warning color indicator
Overdue badge or label visible

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Calendar section
2. View current month
Expected Result:
Calendar displayed correctly
Current date highlighted
Events/tasks shown on calendar

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Calendar
2. Click on date or 'Add Event' button
3. Enter event details (title, date, time, description)
4. Save event
Expected Result:
Event created successfully
Event appears on calendar
Event synced if Google Calendar connected

Prerequisites: User logged in with existing event
Test Steps:
1. Click on event in calendar
2. Modify event details
3. Save changes
Expected Result:
Event updated
Changes reflected in calendar
If synced, updates pushed to Google Calendar

Prerequisites: User logged in with existing event
Test Steps:
1. Click on event in calendar
2. Click Delete button
3. Confirm deletion
Expected Result:
Event removed from calendar
If synced, deleted from Google Calendar
Activity log records deletion

Test Scenario: User can sync with Google Calendar
Prerequisites: User logged in with Google OAuth
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Calendar settings
2. Click 'Connect Google Calendar'
3. Authorize Google Calendar access
4. Configure sync settings
Expected Result:
Google Calendar successfully connected
Events sync bidirectionally
Sync status displayed
Can select which calendars to sync

Test Steps: 1. Click on event in calendar
Expected Result:
Event details modal/page displayed
Shows: title, date/time, description, participants
Shows sync status if applicable

Test Scenario: User can switch calendar view modes
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Calendar
2. Switch between Month, Week, Day views
Expected Result:
View changes correctly
All events displayed appropriately for each view
Navigation works in all views

Test Scenario: User can see all events for dates with multiple events
Prerequisites: User logged in with dates having 3+ events
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Calendar
2. Find date with multiple events
3. Click 'See more' or date with 3+ events
Expected Result:
Modal or expanded view shows all events
All events are clickable
Can navigate to event details

Comment updated

Comment removed

Test Steps:

All comments displayed chronologically

Test Steps:
1. Login as Admin
2. Navigate to admin portal URL

Admin portal accessible
All admin features available
Can manage users, teams, system settings

Test Steps:

2. Try to access admin portal URL

Access denied
Error message or redirect to user portal
Activity log shows unauthorized access attempt

Prerequisites: Leader logged in with team assignment

2. Navigate to team management
3. Try to add/remove members, create tasks
Expected Result:
Can manage assigned team
Can create/edit/delete tasks for team
Can add/remove team members
Cannot access other teams

Test Steps:
1. Login as Member
2. Try to access various features

Can view assigned tasks
Can update own task status
Can add comments
Cannot create/delete tasks
Cannot manage team members

Test Scenario: Only assigned users can see task details
Prerequisites: Member logged in not assigned to task
Test Steps:
1. Login as Member
2. Try to access task not assigned to user
Expected Result:
Task not visible in tasks list
Direct URL access denied or shows error
Cannot view task details

Test Steps:
1. Login with different role users
2. Check dashboard content
Expected Result:
Admin sees system-wide dashboard
Leader sees team-focused dashboard
Member sees personal task dashboard
Each has appropriate widgets and data

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Activity Log section
2. View recent activities
Expected Result:
Activity log displayed
Shows: user, action, timestamp, resource
Chronological order (newest first)

Test Steps:
1. Perform actions (create task, edit team, etc.)
2. Check activity log
Expected Result:
All major actions logged
User creation, task updates, team changes
Login/logout events recorded

Prerequisites: Admin logged in with activity data
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Activity Log
2. Apply filters (user, action type, date range)
3. View results
Expected Result:
Activities filtered correctly
Can filter by multiple criteria
Can export filtered results

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to any page with TMS Chat link
2. Click TMS Chat link
Expected Result:
Opens TMS Chat in new tab
Correct URL domain used
No broken links

Test Steps:
1. Perform action that triggers notification (task assignment)
2. Check email inbox
Expected Result:
Email received
Contains correct information
Links in email work correctly

Test Steps:
1. Open application on mobile device
2. Navigate through different sections
3. Perform common tasks
Expected Result:
UI adapts to mobile screen
All features accessible
Touch interactions work
No horizontal scrolling issues

Test Steps:
1. Use navigation menu
2. Click on different sections
3. Use breadcrumbs if available
Expected Result:
Navigation is intuitive
Current page highlighted
Breadcrumbs show correct path
Can navigate back easily

Test Steps:
1. Try to submit form with invalid data
2. Check validation messages
3. Correct errors and resubmit
Expected Result:
Validation errors shown inline
Error messages are clear
Cannot submit with invalid data
Success message after valid submission

Test Steps:
1. Perform actions that take time (page load, data fetch)
2. Observe loading indicators
Expected Result:
Loading spinner/skeleton shown
User knows system is processing
Loading doesn't freeze interface

Test Steps:
1. Trigger error conditions (network error, invalid action)
2. Observe error handling
Expected Result:
Error messages are user-friendly
Provides guidance on resolution
Option to retry or return
Application doesn't crash

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to different pages
2. Measure load time
Expected Result:
Pages load within 3 seconds on normal connection
No significant lag
Smooth transitions

Test Steps:
1. Use search functionality
2. Search for various terms
3. Measure response time
Expected Result:
Results return within 2 seconds
Results are relevant
Can handle partial matches

Test Steps:
1. Check database
2. Examine password field
Expected Result:
Passwords stored as hashed values (bcrypt)
No plain text passwords visible
Hash format is correct

Test Steps:
1. Login to application
2. Check browser cookies/session
3. Try to tamper with session
Expected Result:
Session tokens are secure (httpOnly)
Tampering invalidates session
Session expires after timeout

Test Steps:
1. Attempt CSRF attack
2. Try to perform action without proper token
Expected Result:
CSRF tokens implemented
Actions require valid tokens
Unauthorized requests rejected

Test Steps:
1. Try SQL injection in input fields
2. Test with common SQL injection payloads
Expected Result:
Inputs are sanitized/parameterized
SQL injection attempts fail
Error messages don't reveal database structure

Test Steps:
1. Try XSS payloads in input fields
2. Test script injection in various forms
Expected Result:
XSS attempts are blocked
Scripts don't execute
Output is properly escaped

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to section with export option
2. Select data to export
3. Choose format (CSV, PDF)
4. Download export
Expected Result:
Data exported successfully
File downloads correctly
Data is complete and formatted properly

Test Steps:
1. Check backup configuration
2. Verify backup schedule
3. Test backup restoration
Expected Result:
Regular backups configured
Backups stored securely
Can restore from backup

Test Steps:
1. Delete/modify data with relationships
2. Check related records
3. Verify referential integrity
Expected Result:
Cascade deletes work correctly
Orphaned records handled properly
Data relationships maintained
